question_text: Which factors make metal halide projector bulbs require special handling? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They operate at extremely high temperatures around 1,000°C
They require gradual cooling to prevent damage
They need frequent cleaning during operation
correct_answer: They operate at extremely high temperatures around 1,000°C
They require gradual cooling to prevent damage
explanation: Metal halide bulbs operate at extreme temperatures, are costly to replace, and need gradual cooling after use. These factors require projectors to have cooling systems, temperature sensors, and post-shutdown cooling cycles to protect the investment.
